title: How to Make a Collar for a Shoplight

steps.headline: Get foamcore.
steps.description: You can find it at most stores that sell arts and crafts and you can also find it at many dollar stores.

steps.headline: Choose a width.
steps.description: Two inches is a good width to start with. Here, the selected width is the width of the level. Another good choice of a width would be the width of your duct tape.

steps.headline: Start measuring out lines about a half inch apart.
steps.description: If you have something that is a little more (or less), like a deck of cards, use it.

steps.headline:

steps.description:
Do not cut through it. That is why a scrolling tool that will serrate the foamcore is a better tool. You will probably need to have two lengths of foamcore to have enough to go around the circumference of a 10 inch (25.4 cm) shoplight. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Creating-a-curve.jpg\/460px-Creating-a-curve.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Creating-a-curve.jpg\/760px-Creating-a-curve.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":484.3956043956044,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Do this to the two lengths of foamcore and then fasten them together with duct tape.
On the non-serrated side of the foamcore, apply duct tape.
Set the shoplight on a flat surface and wrap the foamcore around it.
steps.description: Use scissors or a sharp edge to trip it to the correct length.

steps.headline: After taping the outside of the collar, use scissors to cut it to the correct length to go around the light.

text:
Get foamcore. You can find it at most stores that sell arts and crafts and you can also find it at many dollar stores. Choose a width. Two inches is a good width to start with. Here, the selected width is the width of the level. Another good choice of a width would be the width of your duct tape. Start measuring out lines about a half inch apart. If you have something that is a little more (or less), like a deck of cards, use it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/06\/Serrated-or-scoring-lines.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/06\/Serrated-or-scoring-lines.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":450,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":743.0167597765363,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Start cutting the foamcore. Do not cut through it. That is why a scrolling tool that will serrate the foamcore is a better tool. You will probably need to have two lengths of foamcore to have enough to go around the circumference of a 10 inch (25.4 cm) shoplight. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Creating-a-curve.jpg\/460px-Creating-a-curve.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Creating-a-curve.jpg\/760px-Creating-a-curve.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":484.3956043956044,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Do this to the two lengths of foamcore and then fasten them together with duct tape. On the non-serrated side of the foamcore, apply duct tape. Set the shoplight on a flat surface and wrap the foamcore around it. Use scissors or a sharp edge to trip it to the correct length. After taping the outside of the collar, use scissors to cut it to the correct length to go around the light.
